intro: Phlox drummondii var. instabilis, commonly known as the unstable common phlox, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in well-drained soil and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. It is known for its relatively short blooming period, usually lasting from late spring to early summer. The "instabilis" variety is noted for its tendency to exhibit variability in flower color and growth habit, which adds to its appeal among horticulturists.
